==Events==
*[[1010]] &ndash; [[Ferdowsi]] completes his epic poem [[Shahnameh|Shāhnāmeh]].
*[[1126]] &ndash; Following the death of his mother Urraca, [[Alfonso VII of León and Castile|Alfonso VII]] is proclaimed king of [[Castile and León]].
*[[1204]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Château Gaillard]] ends in a French victory over King [[John, King of England|John of England]], who loses control of [[Normandy]] to King [[Philip II of France|Philip II Augustus]].
*[[1576]] &ndash; Spanish explorer Diego García de Palacio first sights the ruins of the ancient [[Maya civilization|Mayan]] city of [[Copán]].
*[[1618]] &ndash; [[Johannes Kepler]] discovers the [[Kepler's laws of planetary motion|third law of planetary motion]].
*[[1655]] &ndash; [[John Casor]] becomes the first legally-recognized slave in England's [[Thirteen Colonies|North American colonies]] where a crime was not committed.
*[[1658]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Roskilde]]: After a devastating defeat in the [[Northern Wars]] (1655–1661), [[Frederick III of Denmark|Frederick III]], the King of [[Denmark-Norway]] is forced to give up nearly half his territory to [[Sweden]] to save the rest.
*[[1702]] &ndash; [[Anne, Queen of Great Britain|Anne Stuart]], sister of [[Mary II of England|Mary II]], becomes [[Queen regnant]] of [[Kingdom of England|England]], [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scotland]], and [[Kingdom of Ireland|Ireland]].
*[[1722]] &ndash; The [[Safavid Empire]] of [[Iran]] is defeated by an army from [[History of Afghanistan|Afghanistan]] at [[The Battle of Gulnabad]], pushing Iran into anarchy.
*[[1736]] &ndash; [[Nader Shah]], founder of the [[Afsharid dynasty]], is crowned [[Shah of Iran]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; An anonymous writer, thought by some to be [[Thomas Paine]], publishes "African Slavery in America", the first article in the American colonies calling for the [[abolitionism in the United States|emancipation]] of slaves and the abolition of slavery.
*[[1777]] &ndash; Regiments from [[Germans in the American Revolution#Ansbach-Bayreuth|Ansbach and Bayreuth]], sent to support [[Great Britain]] in the [[American Revolutionary War]], mutiny in the town of [[Ochsenfurt]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[Gnadenhutten massacre|Gnadenhütten massacre]]: Ninety-six [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]] in [[Gnadenhutten, Ohio|Gnadenhutten]], [[Ohio]], who had converted to [[Christianity]] are killed by [[Pennsylvania]] militiamen in retaliation for raids carried out by other Indians.
*[[1801]] &ndash; [[War of the Second Coalition]]: At the [[Battle of Abukir (1801)|Battle of Abukir]], a British force under Sir [[Ralph Abercromby]] lands in Egypt with the aim of ending the [[French campaign in Egypt and Syria]].
*[[1817]] &ndash; The [[New York Stock Exchange]] is founded.
*[[1844]] &ndash; [[Monarchy of Sweden|King]] [[Oscar I of Sweden|Oscar I]] ascends to the thrones of [[Union between Sweden and Norway|Sweden and Norway]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The iron-clad {{Ship|CSS|Virginia}} (formerly {{USS|Merrimack|1855|6}}) is launched at [[Hampton Roads]], [[Virginia]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Sakai incident]]: Japanese [[samurai]] kill 11 French sailors in the port of [[Sakai, Osaka|Sakai]] near [[Osaka]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[French people|French]] [[aviator|aviatrix]] [[Raymonde de Laroche]] becomes the first woman to receive a [[Pilot licensing and certification|pilot's license]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[International Women's Day]] is launched in [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]], by [[Clara Zetkin]], leader of the Women's Office for the Social Democratic Party in [[Germany]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; First flights (for the [[Royal Thai Air Force]]) at [[Don Mueang International Airport]] in [[Bangkok]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: A [[British Empire|British]] force unsuccessfully attempts to relieve the siege of [[Kut]] (present-day [[Iraq]]) in the [[Battle of Dujaila]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; International Women's Day protests in [[St. Petersburg]] mark the beginning of the [[February Revolution]] (so named because it was February on the [[Julian calendar]]).
*  1917   &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] votes to limit [[filibuster]]s by adopting the [[cloture rule]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Arab Kingdom of Syria]], the first modern [[Arab]] state to come into existence, is established.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Prime Minister of Spain|Premier]] [[Eduardo Dato Iradier]] is assassinated while exiting the [[Cortes Generales|parliament]] building in [[Madrid]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Castle Gate mine disaster]] kills 172 coal miners near [[Castle Gate, Utah]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Daytona Beach Road Course]] holds its first oval [[stock car racing|stock car]] race.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Guadalajara]] begins.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Netherlands|Dutch]] surrender to Japanese forces on [[Java (island)|Java]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; Thirteen thousand troops sent by the [[Kuomintang]] government of [[Republic of China|China]] arrive in [[Taiwan]] after the [[228 Incident]] and launch crackdowns which kill thousands of people, including many elites. This turns into a major root of the [[Taiwan independence movement]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Mildred Gillars]] ("Axis Sally") is condemned to prison for treason.
*  1949   &ndash; [[President of France]] [[Vincent Auriol]] and ex-emperor [[Bảo Đại]] sign the [[Élysée Accords]], giving Vietnam greater independence from France and creating the [[State of Vietnam]] to oppose [[Viet Minh]]-led [[North Vietnam|Democratic Republic of Vietnam]]. 
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Egypt]] re-opens the [[Suez Canal]] after the [[Suez Crisis]].
*  1957   &ndash; The [[1957 Georgia Memorial to Congress]], which petitions the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] to declare the ratification of the 14th and 15th Amendments to the [[U.S. Constitution]] null and void, is adopted by the [[U.S. state of Georgia]].
*  1957   &ndash; [[Ghana]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[Ba'ath Party]] comes to power in [[Syria]] in a [[coup d'état]] by a clique of quasi-leftist Syrian Army officers calling themselves the National Council of the Revolutionary Command.
*[[1966]] &ndash; A bomb planted by [[Irish Republicans]] destroys [[Nelson's Pillar]] in [[Dublin]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Charles de Gaulle Airport]] opens in [[Paris, France]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The first radio episode of ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy (radio series)|The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]'', by [[Douglas Adams]], is transmitted on [[BBC Radio 4]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Philips]] demonstrates the [[Compact Disc]] publicly for the first time.
*[[1983]] &ndash; U.S. [[President of the United States|President]] [[Ronald Reagan]] calls the Soviet Union an "[[evil empire]]".
*[[1985]] &ndash; A [[1985 Beirut Car Bombing|failed assassination attempt]] on [[Sayyed Mohammad Hussein Fadlallah]] in [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]], kills at least 45 and injures 175 others.
*[[2004]] &ndash; A new [[Law of Administration for the State of Iraq for the Transitional Period|constitution]] is signed by [[Iraq]]'s [[Iraqi Governing Council|Governing Council]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]] disappears over the [[Gulf of Thailand]] en route to [[Beijing]] from [[Kuala Lumpur]].  The aircraft is believed to have crashed into the [[Indian Ocean]] off the coast of [[Australia]] with all 239 people on board dead.

*Christian [[Feast Day]]:
**[[John of God]]
**[[Philemon the actor]]
**[[Geoffrey Studdert Kennedy]], [[Edward King (bishop of Lincoln)|Edward King]], [[Felix of Burgundy]] ([[Church of England]]) 
*Earliest day on which [[Canberra Day]] can fall, while March 14 is the latest; celebrated on the second Monday in March ([[Australian Capital Territory]])
*Earliest day on which [[Commonwealth Day]] can fall, while March 14 is the latest; celebrated on the second Monday in March ([[Commonwealth of Nations]])
*Earliest day on which [[Passion Sunday]] can fall, while April 17 is the latest; observed on the fifth Sunday of [[Lent]] ([[Christianity]])
*[[International Women's Day]] or [[Mother's Day]] (primarily [[Eastern Europe]], [[Russia]], and the former [[Soviet bloc]])
